CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 6, 1945, pg. 2 reads: " "Rights" Case Goes To Court - George Lai, proprietor of Lai's Restaurant, 970 Liberty Avenue, is shown posting cash bond before Alderman Harry Fitzgerald following the waiving of the Equal Rights case brought by George Rodman, 49 Washington Street (far left), to court.  Lai's attorney, and Constable J.B. Bolden who had trouble arresting Lai, are shown in the center of the photo.  The people on the right were witnesses in another case. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: George Rodman, plaintiff in equal rights case against restaurant owner George Lai in center holding cash roll posting bond, Lai's attorney Constable J. B. Bolden, and two unknown women, facing Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald
